author: Al Jazeera
description: Ongoing violence prompts 'mass exodus' from Marawi, as President Rodrigo Duterte considers nationwide martial law.
title: Mindanao: Churchgoers 'taken hostage' amid Marawi siege

description: Gunfire rings out as army tanks roll into the southern Philippine city of Marawi to repel Islamist insurgents.
title: Philippines troops enter Marawi as insurgents take hostages, raise IS flag

author: Colin Dwyer
description: An attempt to arrest a local militant group's leader went awry in Marawi City on Tuesday. By nightfall, militants occupied public buildings and the Philippine president cut his Russia trip short.
title: Duterte Declares Limited Martial Law As Bloodshed Breaks Out In Marawi City

description: Extremisten enthaupten den Polizeichef von Marawi und hissen dort die IS-Flagge. Das Militär versucht, die Kontrolle über die Stadt im Süden der Philippinen wiederzuerlangen. Die Lage ist unübersichtlich.
title: Eskalation in Marawi: Stadt auf Philippinen verhängt nach IS-Angriff das Kriegsrecht

description: As battles raged with ISIS-linked militants seizing buildings in Marawi City.
title: Duterte Declares Martial Law in South Philippines

author: Al Jazeera
description: Emergency declaration follows heavy clashes between security forces and fighters in Mindanao's Marawi city.
title: Duterte declares martial law after Mindanao attack

author: Al Jazeera
description: Residents flee Mindanao's Marawi city as fighters reportedly behead a local police chief and take churchgoers hostage.
title: Duterte considers martial law for entire Philippines

author: Andreo Calonzo, Siegfrid Alegado
description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte placed the southern island of Mindanao under military rule Tuesday night after terrorists linked to Islamic State clashed with government troops in Marawi, the most populous city in the island’s Muslim region.
title: Duterte Puts Mindanao Under Martial Law After Terrorist Clashes

author: Colin Dwyer
description: With an island under martial law and civilians escaping Marawi City, which is occupied by ISIS-linked militants, President Rodrigo Duterte struck a hard line Wednesday: "If you fight us you will die."
title: After Botched Raid, Philippines Tries To Reclaim A City Under Siege

author: JIM GOMEZ and TERESA CEROJANO
description: MARAWI, Philippines (AP) — Army tanks packed with soldiers rolled into a southern Philippine city Thursday as gunfire and explosions rang out after militants linked to the Islamic State group torched buildings, seized more than a dozen Catholic hostages and raised the black flag of ISIS. At least 21 people have died in fighting that erupted late Tuesday, when the army raided the Marawi hideout of Isnilon Hapilon, who is on Washington's list of most-wanted terrorists and has a $5 million bounty on his head.
title: Islamic State-linked militants besiege Philippine city
